description: The iMAP sends the heartbeat notification trap to the NMS
regularly each period. If the NMS receives the trap, the
connection between the NMS and the iMAP works. If not,
the connection fails.

event.Summary: IMAP north bound heartbeat notification occurred

description: Managed system ID: indicates the managed system from which the heartbeat notification is reported.
It uniquely identifies one EMS.
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundHeartbeatSystemLabel

description: Heartbeat period (must be between 3 and 3600), in seconds
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundHeartbeatPeriod

description: Time stamp: the time when the heartbeat notification is generated
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundHeartbeatTimeStamp

description: The iMAP system sends real-time alarms to the NMS using this trap.
If an alarm occurs to an NE or the iMAP, the iMAP sends the alarm
trap to the NMS.

description: Serial number of the alarm > 0.
An alarm is identified by a unique number.
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmCSN

description: Category can be one of the following:
1 - Fault
2 - Clear
3 - Event
4 - Acknowledge
5 - Unacknowledge
9 - Change
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmCategory

description: Fault occurrence time, time at which the alarm has been raised.
This node's value is dependent on UTCTime and timetype parameters in snmpagent.xml
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmOccurTime

description: Managed object name for which the alarm has been generated
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmMOName

description: Product type ID:
1 - transmission
2 - mobile
3 - fixed network narrowband
4 - fixed network broadband
5 - intelligent network
6 - omc
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmProductID

description: Network Element Type ID
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmNEType

description: Network Element ID or Device ID
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmNEDevID

description: Serial number of the alarm device, unique in the same NE.
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmDevCsn

description: Alarm ID of the generated alarm
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmID

description: Alarm type. It can be one of the following:
1 - Power System
2 - Environment System
3 - Signaling System
4 - Trunk System
5 - Hardware System
6 - Software System
7 - Running System
8 - Communication System
9 - QoS
10 - Processing error
11 - OMC
12 - Integrity Violation
13 - Operational Violation
14 - Physical Violation
15 - Security Service Or Mechanism Violation
16 - Time Domain Violation
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmType

description: Level is the alarm severity. It can be one of the following:
1 - Critical
2 - Major
3 - Minor
4 - Warning
5 - Indeterminate
6 - Clear
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmLevel

description: Alarm clear status
1 - Cleared
2 - Uncleared
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmRestore

description: Alarm acknowledgement status
1 - Acknowledged
2 - Unacknowledged
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmConfirm

description: Alarm acknowledgement time.
This node's value is dependent on UTCTime and timetype parameters in snmpagent.xml
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmAckTime

description: Alarm clearance time.
This node's value is dependent on UTCTime and timetype parameters in snmpagent.xml
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmRestoreTime

description: Operator, who performs the acknowledgement and clearance operations.
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmOperator

description: Reserved field 1
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas1

description: Reserved field 2
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas2

description: Reserved field 3
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas3

description: Reserved field 4
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas4

description: Reserved field 5
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas5

description: Reserved field 6
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas6

description: Reserved field 7
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas7

description: Reserved field 8
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas8

description: Reserved field 9
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas9

description: Original alarm level,
defined by the device when the alarm is generated.
1 Critical
2 Major
3 Minor
4 Warning
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas10

description: Extended information (max: 250 characters)
Alarm extended information, including the location information of the alarm.
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmExtendInfo

description: Probable cause of the alarm
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmProbablecause

description: Alarm repair recommendations
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmProposedrepairactions

description: Alarm detailed reasons
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmSpecificproblems

description: This is one of 15 extensible alarm fields to be
reported as part of alarm information. The fields
to be reported are decided by the configuration
for the SNMP agent in file snmpagent.xml. For
string type parameters the maximum supported
length is 250 characters. If string is longer it
will be truncated to 250 characters.

description: The operator who cleared this alarm.
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmClearOperator

description: Additional Information regarding the alarm
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmAdditionalInfo

description: This specifies the Clear Type of alarms.
1 - Normal Clear
2 - Restore Clear
3 - Manual Clear
4 - Configure Clear
5 - Co-relation Clear
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmClearType

description: This specifies the Clear Category of alarms.
1 - ADAC (Automatically Detected Automcatically Cleared)
2 - ADMC (Automatically Detected Manually Cleared)
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmClearCategory

description: Affecting service flag for the alarm
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmServiceAffectFlag

description: Object instance type for the raised alarm
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmObjectInstanceType

description: The iMAP notifies the NMS of the start of the query.
After the NMS receives the active/current alarm query start
trap, the query starts.
The trap is triggered by NMS for alarm query.
The iMAP system sends queried alarms to the NMS using this trap.

Summary.eval: ($v11 == 6) ? 'Fault alarm query notification cleared' : 'Fault alarm query notification occurred'

description: Serial number of the alarm > 0.
An alarm is identified by a unique number.
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmCSN

description: Category can be one of the following:
1 - Fault
2 - Clear
3 - Event
4 - Acknowledge
5 - Unacknowledge
9 - Change
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmCategory

description: Fault occurrence time, time at which the alarm has been raised.
This node's value is dependent on UTCTime and timetype parameters in snmpagent.xml
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmOccurTime

description: Managed object name for which the alarm has been generated
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmMOName

description: Product type ID:
1 - transmission
2 - mobile
3 - fixed network narrowband
4 - fixed network broadband
5 - intelligent network
6 - omc
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmProductID

description: Network Element Type ID
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmNEType

description: Network Element ID or Device ID
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmNEDevID

description: Serial number of the alarm device, unique in the same NE.
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmDevCsn

description: Alarm ID of the generated alarm
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmID

description: Alarm type. It can be one of the following:
1 - Power System
2 - Environment System
3 - Signaling System
4 - Trunk System
5 - Hardware System
6 - Software System
7 - Running System
8 - Communication System
9 - QoS
10 - Processing error
11 - OMC
12 - Integrity Violation
13 - Operational Violation
14 - Physical Violation
15 - Security Service Or Mechanism Violation
16 - Time Domain Violation
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmType

description: Level is the alarm severity. It can be one of the following:
1 - Critical
2 - Major
3 - Minor
4 - Warning
5 - Indeterminate
6 - Clear
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmLevel

description: Alarm clear status
1 - Cleared
2 - Uncleared
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmRestore

description: Alarm acknowledgement status
1 - Acknowledged
2 - Unacknowledged
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmConfirm

description: Alarm acknowledgement time.
This node's value is dependent on UTCTime and timetype parameters in snmpagent.xml
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmAckTime

description: Alarm clearance time.
This node's value is dependent on UTCTime and timetype parameters in snmpagent.xml
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmRestoreTime

description: Operator, who performs the acknowledgement and clearance operations.
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmOperator

description: Reserved field 1
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas1

description: Reserved field 2
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas2

description: Reserved field 3
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas3

description: Reserved field 4
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas4

description: Reserved field 5
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas5

description: Reserved field 6
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas6

description: Reserved field 7
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas7

description: Reserved field 8
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas8

description: Reserved field 9
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas9

description: Original alarm level,
defined by the device when the alarm is generated.
1 Critical
2 Major
3 Minor
4 Warning
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmParas10

description: Extended information (max: 250 characters)
Alarm extended information, including the location information of the alarm.
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmExtendInfo

description: Probable cause of the alarm
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmProbablecause

description: Alarm repair recommendations
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmProposedrepairactions

description: Alarm detailed reasons
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmSpecificproblems

description: This is one of 15 extensible alarm fields to be
reported as part of alarm information. The fields
to be reported are decided by the configuration
for the SNMP agent in file snmpagent.xml. For
string type parameters the maximum supported
length is 250 characters. If string is longer it
will be truncated to 250 characters.

description: The operator who cleared this alarm.
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmClearOperator

description: Additional Information regarding the alarm
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmAdditionalInfo

description: Affecting service flag for the alarm
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmServiceAffectFlag

description: This specifies the Clear Type of alarms.
1 - Normal Clear
2 - Restore Clear
3 - Manual Clear
4 - Configure Clear
5 - Co-relation Clear
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmClearType

description: This specifies the Clear Category of alarms.
1 - ADAC (Automatically Detected Automcatically Cleared)
2 - ADMC (Automatically Detected Manually Cleared)
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmClearCategory

description: Object instance type for the raised alarm
variables.name: IMAP-NORTHBOUND-MIB-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmObjectInstanceType

description: The iMAP notifies the NMS of the stop of the query.
After the NMS receives the active/current alarm query stop
trap, it indicates that the query ends.
The NMS triggers the stop of the query, or the query
ends after the NMS receives the active/current alarms.
